title: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
summary: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi (born Mahesh Prasad Varma, 12 January 1918[2] â€“ 5 February 2008) was an Indian yoga guru,[3] known for developing and popularizing Transcendental Meditation, and for being the leader and guru of a worldwide organization that has been characterized in multiple ways including as a new religious movement and as non-religious.[4][5][6] He became known as Maharishi (meaning "great seer")[1][7] and Yogi as an adult.[8][9]
